com.redhat.rhn.manager.errata

Class ErrataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.manager.BaseManager
      • com.redhat.rhn.manager.errata.ErrataManager

  • public class ErrataManager
extends BaseManager
    ErrataManager is the singleton class used to provide business operations on Errata, where those operations interact with other top tier business objects. Operations that require changes to the Errata.

    • Field Summary

      • publish

        public static Errata publish(Errata unpublished,
             java.util.Collection channelIds,
             User user)
        Takes an unpublished errata and returns a published errata into the channels we pass in. NOTE: This method does NOT update the errata cache for the channels. That is done when packages are pushed as part of the errata publication process (which is not done here)
        Parameters:
        unpublished - The errata to publish
        channelIds - The Long channelIds we want to publish this Errata to.
        user - who is publishing errata
        Returns:
        Returns a published errata.

      • errataCVEs

                           java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        eid - The id of the errata you're checking
        name - The advisory name you're checking
        Returns:

      • cloneErrataApi

        public static java.lang.Object[] cloneErrataApi(Channel chan,
                                java.util.Collection<Errata> errata,
                                User user,
                                boolean inheritPackages)
        Clone errata to a channel
        Parameters:
        chan - the channel
        errata - list of errata ids
        user - the user doing the push
        inheritPackages - inherit packages from the original bug (instaed of the clone in the case of a clone of a clone)
        Returns:
        an array of Errata that have been published

      • cloneErrataApi

        public static java.lang.Object[] cloneErrataApi(Channel chan,
                                java.util.Collection<Errata> errata,
                                User user,
                                boolean inheritPackages,
                                boolean performPostActions)
        Clone errata to a channel
        Parameters:
        chan - the channel
        errata - list of errata ids
        user - the user doing the push
        inheritPackages - inherit packages from the original bug (instaed of the clone in the case of a clone of a clone)
        performPostActions - true (default) if you want to refresh newest package cache and schedule repomd regeneration. False only if you're going to do those things yourself.
        Returns:
        an array of Errata that have been published

                      java.lang.Long toCid,
                      User user)

        Parameters:
        fromCid - id of old channel
        toCid - id of channel to clone into
        user - the requesting user

      • applyErrataHelper

                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> errataIds,

      • applyErrata

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Long> applyErrata(User user,
                                         java.util.List errataIds,
                                         java.util.Date earliest,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.Long> serverIds)
        Apply a list of errata to a list of servers.
        Parameters:
        user - user
        errataIds - errata ids
        earliest - schedule time
        serverIds - server ids
        Returns:
        list of action ids

      • applyErrata

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Long> applyErrata(User user,
                                         java.util.List errataIds,
                                         java.util.Date earliest,
                                         ActionChain actionChain,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.Long> serverIds)
        Apply a list of errata to a list of servers, with an optional Action Chain. Note that not all erratas are applied to all systems. Systems get only the erratas relevant for them.
        Parameters:
        user - user
        errataIds - errata ids
        earliest - schedule time
        actionChain - the action chain to add the action to or null
        serverIds - server ids
        Returns:
        list of action ids
